result.execSummary:
The defendant Knowles Gil Gaillard was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "A"], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "B"], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court ordered defendant pay all court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA) by 12-15-15. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
Consecutive to: To any other sentence, but CONCURRENT to Count 2. With credit for 56 days.
Consecutive to: To any other sentence, but CONCURRENT to Count 1. With credit for 56 days.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Knowles Gil Gaillard

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: See CCAP financial payment plan application for specific monthly due dates for this UTPPP.

Order signed and filed on 12-28-15.


The fine, costs and surcharges shall be paid on or before 9/15/16.  Special terms:  $100.00 per month starting 1/15/16 and due on the 15th of each month until paid.  All other conditions imposed shall remain the same.

*defendant's copy forwarded to Outreach Community Health Center this date*
Per Order of Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. Dennis R. Cimpl, Br. 19, for review. jbs

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

As to Count 1:
The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 6 MONTHS at the House of Corrections with 56 days credit CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence, but CONCURRENT to Count 2.

As to Count 2:
The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 3 MONTHS at the House of Corrections with 56 days credit CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence, but CONCURRENT to Count 1.

Court ordered the defendant pay all court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA) by 12/15/2015.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

Filed:  
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Pre-trial Incarceration Credit

Case in court for Jury Trial, however parties wish to proceed with plea and sentencing instead.  Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.

Defendant Knowles Gil Gaillard in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Defendant Knowles Gil Gaillard in custody.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Filed, original amended information; copy served on defendant.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of information, waives formal reading, pleads not guilty.  
Court ordered charge amended to:
Count 1- Misdemeanor Battery, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 940.19(1) and 939.51(3)(a), a Class A Misdemeanor.
Count 2- Disorderly Conduct, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 947.01(1) and 939.51(3)(b), a Class B Misdemeanor.
State's Witness List received and filed.

Attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke in court, defendant Knowles Gil Gaillard not in court, in custody.  Matthew Adrian Lamke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for plea and sentencing however defense requests a jury trial date.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Jury trial scheduled for December 15, 2014 at 09:00 am.

Attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke in court, defendant Knowles Gil Gaillard not in court, in custody.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for 09-25-2014 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Matthew A Lamke in court, defendant Knowles Gil Gaillard not in court, in custody.  Thomas L Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Pre-trial conference scheduled for 07-09-2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Knowles Gil Gaillard in court with attorney Matthew A Lamke.  Thomas L Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Status conference scheduled for 06-02-2014 at 08:30 am.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Jennifer E. 
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Knowles Gil Gaillard in court with attorney Matthew A Lamke.  Defendant Knowles Gil Gaillard in custody.  Thomas L Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 7, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  Absolutely no release from home, GPS monitoring (24 Hour Curfew). ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY  to be monitored by drug testing. No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed, no alcohol.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Knowles Gil Gaillard in court with attorney Darryl E Smith.  Defendant Knowles Gil Gaillard in custody.  Paul L Tiffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 21, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
